title: Dan, we missed your birthday!
author: dezcom

comments.content:
Viel zu spaet, aber doch.: Alles, alles Gute, Dan..  
_Happy ( belated ) Birthday.. ( Almost ) 28 Days Later.. :)  
From formlos, with love.. :)_

 ![](http://web.archive.org/system/files?file=B00005JMA6.01.LZZZZZZZ.jpg)
  
    
Dav

Yes, Chris, that is exactly why! Thank you anyway ;-)  
I think that my birthday might go unnoticed because I have the priviledge to share it with a certain (much more talented) designer from Malakoff.

Chris, your wig isn’t that far off. Here is the biggest hair-photo I’ve got:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/system/files?file=dan_big_hair.jpg)

And this is more-or-less what I look like now:

 ![](system/files?file=Dan%20at%20Mont%20Saint%20Michel.jpg)

This birthday was my 26th. I am getting so old!

Same day as Jean-François’!? Bugger me senseless, another one to add to our birthday calendar in the kitchen. Happy extremely belated birthday, Dan! Hope you had a good one and that the presents were nice.

Thanks, Yves! I got three nice presents:

_Typolemik/Typophil_ by Hans-Peter Willberg  
_Thinking with Type_ by Ellen Lupton  
_Chronik der D. Stempel AG 1895–1955_
Dan I have jeans older than you. Happy Birthday and I hope the holidays brought you joy as well.

Dan, your hair was much shorter at TypeCon. I like the new you—letting your freak-Flag fly :-)

ChrisL

_freak-Flag fly_

Well, it is a bit windy at Mont St Michel…
Happy Belated Birthday, Dan! You think _you’re_ old, I turn 28 in a week! Yikes!

A very Happy Belated Birthday.  
… and I truly am jealous of your hair.

In my yewt I also sported an admirable coiff but years have thinned it out! :-(

 ![](http://web.archive.org/system/files?file=Eraserhead.png)

OK, Norbert, so did you do any boxing promotion then?

Also, contrary to popular belief, I had actual hair when I was 24 but not as much as Dan.

ChrisL

 ![](system/files?file=chris%201967.jpg)

_С Днём Рождения, Дан!_

Sorry it’s a bit _pozdnovato_
Terry, you have the same birthday as Wolfgang Weingart!

Guess we will be seeing Terry use a lot of AG in his designs then :-)

ChrisL
